SEARCH
Package org.maps

Class MapManager

java.lang.Object
org.maps.Map
org.maps.MapManager
public class MapManager extends Map
The MapManager class is responsible for managing maps in a game environment.

It extends the base Map class and is associated with a specific GameScreen instance. The class provides methods for loading map images, reading map data from files, and drawing the map on a myGraphics2D context.

Author:
Usman Aziz, Nicole Malku

  • Constructor Details

    • MapManager

      public MapManager(GameScreen screen)
      Constructs a MapManager object associated with a specific GameScreen instance.

      This constructor initializes the MapManager with the provided GameScreen and sets up the required data structures. It creates an array of Map objects, a two-dimensional array to store map numbers, and loads map images. Additionally, it loads a specific map based on the provided mapToLoad parameter.

      Parameters:
      screen - The GameScreen instance to associate with this MapManager.

  • Method Details

    • getMapImg

      public void getMapImg()
      Retrieves and initializes map images for a specific game scenario.

      This method populates an array of Map objects, each containing an image and collision information. The images are loaded using the ImageIO class from the specified resource paths. In case of an IOException during image loading, a stack trace is printed.

    • loadMap

      public void loadMap(String S)
      Loads a map from a specified file and populates the mapNum array.
      Parameters:
      S - The name of the file to be loaded.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the file.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D myGraphics, String mapIMGpath)
      Draws the map on the specified myGraphics2D context.

      This method loads a map image from the "/maps/" directory and draws it onto the provided myGraphics2D context at the coordinates (0, 0).

      In case of an IOException during image loading, the exception details are printed to the standard error stream.

      Parameters:
      myGraphics - The myGraphics2D context on which to draw the map.
